body:
in that case, can we make it build beam only when it has support for it.
ie. build scala 2.10 - beam 2.0.0
build scala 2.11 - beam not included (but not failing)

I decided to put floppy icon as in `advanced-transformation-setting`.

@fred521 Could you please describe issues that you have faced?

> UI-Grid actually creates a lot of performance issue, why not deprecate it but still introducing new feature?
> 
> In my service, I completely wiped out UI-Grid

What are the performance issues with UI-Grid? We should improve him, not give up on him.

It wonâ€™t well as long as you use this component.

The ui-Grid will generate tons of watchers in angularjs

For example, 10 paragraphs of ui-grid in one notebook, and each paragraph
has 10k records .

It will generate 22k watchers in the angularjs session, slow down speed and
performance a lot.

Test that in some kind of angularjs debug tool.

https://github.com/angular-ui/ui-grid/issues/5547


On Wed, Dec 19, 2018 at 17:47 Xun Liu <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> UI-Grid actually creates a lot of performance issue, why not deprecate it
> but still introducing new feature?
>
> In my service, I completely wiped out UI-Grid
>
> What are the performance issues with UI-Grid? We should improve him, not
> give up on him.
>

Thanks for review, @felixcheung @zjffdu . We are deploying zeppelin recently and try to use with some flink interpreter. I will share some details later..Currently I personally feel that it looks lack of flink sql usage doc. From [here](http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.9.0-SNAPSHOT/interpreter/flink.html) it seems only have api example. Also I wonder whether zeppelin could support flink table api or future will do. Thanks, @zjffdu
it looks like the github rebase and merge option is picking the last commit description

It seems to be important.

What alternative solution did you find for table vizualization?
@felixcheung I think it would be better to squash and merge with some edit of title indicating an issue number. WDYT?
BTW, could you please enable CI? Please check https://travis-ci.org/xueyumusic
Hi, @jongyoul , I enabled CI, the latest commit travis test is https://travis-ci.org/xueyumusic/zeppelin/builds/470364971, thanks
@xueyumusic I did some work recently to enable table api for flink. Will create a new PR when it's ready.

Github doesnâ€™t let me edit title. I think committer should use the merge script and not the github Web UI.

If you think this is a problem, let me know
I've tested my wip pr by clicking squash and merge button on the pr page. I saw we could edit a title and commit messages as well. Could you please check it again?
@xueyumusic Flink community is starting the release of 1.7.1, do you mind to wait for the release of 1.7.1 ?
I think it would be better to wait for flink-1.7.1 release, it seems to fix several bugs of 1.7.0. Thank you~ @zjffdu

Squash and merge seems like the right option,
https://help.github.com/articles/merging-a-pull-request/
@conker84 sorry, could you see if you could re open this PR so I can merge again?
@felixcheung Thanks a lot ðŸ‘

It looks current [0.9.0-SNAPSHOT](http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.9.0-SNAPSHOT/setup/setup/security/notebook_authorization.html) and 0.8.0 online doc links are still broken, may be need re-publish online doc? @zjffdu @felixcheung
Looks fine for me

@liuxunorg What is the behavior if I changed interpreter in one paragraph ? e.g. I change the interpreter from submarine to python. Would the font size change if these 2 interpreter has different config for font size ? If yes, when that change happens ?

> @liuxunorg What is the behavior if I changed interpreter in one paragraph ? e.g. I change the interpreter from submarine to python. Would the font size change if these 2 interpreter has different config for font size ? If yes, when that change happens ?

@zjffdu , Thank you are asking is a good question!
Now if you are using a default interpreter with the config attribute set (for example: submarine), adding a paragraph of any other type of interpreter to this note will follow the submarine config configuration, since submarine is the default interpreter.

I will improve the implementation of this function, and also control the display of the front-end paragraphs in the interpreter process according to the configuration in `interpreter-setting.json`.
CI Passed. https://travis-ci.org/jongyoul/zeppelin/builds/471361767. Ready to review.

@liuxunorg What I ask is that if I changed interpreter of the same paragraph to another interpreter. The interpreter is determined by the magic part of user code. That means you can change the interpreter when user type code. I just wonder what is the behavior if I changed the interpreter from `%submarine` to `%python` for the same paragraph.
@xueyumusic flink 1.7.1 is released, could you update this PR ?

Hi, @zjffdu , I just tried update `flink.version` as 1.7.1 in zeppelin flink pom, it looks weird that could not resolve dependency such as ` org.apache.flink:flink-clients_2.11:jar:1.7.1` etc.. From [maven repository](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.flink/flink-clients) it looks that don't have flinke 1.7.1 right now.. Thanks
Maybe the artifacts is not released yet, let's wait for a few days.
What about merge?
merging if no more comment

@zjffdu , @jongyoul , @felixcheung  Can now support any time, no matter which default interpreter you use, You can dynamically modify the interpreter type when you execute it. :-)

closing this for lack of time. i'll use this for my own testing:
`mvn clean package -Pbuild-distr -DskipTests -Pspark-2.4 -Phadoop-2.7 -Pscala-2.11 -p !beam`

particularly: add [ZEPPELIN-*Jira number*] in PR title, eg. [ZEPPELIN-533]
and a description of what is changed.

also update the PR description. thx

ping?
Description and title has been changed

please setup CI:

Thanks, I've switched zeppelin on and 'build branch updates' was on already. Maybe it was renamed to 'Build pushed branches'. 'Build pushed pull branches' is also on.

Hello @tiboun,
I had 1 more query. Have you tested zeppelin rest api's with keycloak enabled. ?
For ex : [Interpreter api endpoint](https://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.8.0/usage/rest_api/interpreter.html)

FYI, I don't think we build docker, for future PR:
```
Looks like travis-ci is not configured for your fork.
Please setup by swich on 'zeppelin' repository at https://travis-ci.org/profile and travis-ci.
And then make sure 'Build branch updates' option is enabled in the settings https://travis-ci.org/keineahnung2345/zeppelin/settings.

```

@felixcheung I am new to travis and I cannot find the option 'Build branch updates' in my repo's settings. And there is no other branches for me to select: I've tried adding ``` branches: only: - spark_mesos ``` in .travis.yml in my repo's master branch. I also tried creating a PR in my own repo(from spark_mesos branch to master branch), but nothing changes, what should I do?
Ready to review

Keycloak enabled is compatible with the rest API from browser side. We need to simulate the code authentication flow programmatically. I'll try to give a script for that. Maybe you already have one ^^.

hmm, not sure why, this is the error, but I don't see recent changes that might have broken it

```

09:52:10,841  INFO org.apache.zeppelin.notebook.Paragraph:381 - Run paragraph [paragraph_id: paragraph_1546509130838_525871799, interpreter: org.apache.zeppelin.spark.SparkInterpreter, note_id: 2DZC2NGPW, user: anonymous]

@keineahnung2345 hi - didn't see the message above. I think travis has changed the UI since we had that instruction, but Build pushed branch should do it?

let's try again next PR.
Yup.. let me take a look
@felixcheung , I revert `Optimize the execution efficiency of the NotebookServer::onUpdate(...) function.` And CI Pass https://travis-ci.org/liuxunorg/zeppelin/builds/475618439
Merging this if no more discussion.

Happy new year guys! I've waited for the release of 0.8.1 but I made a mistake and upgraded my Cloudera to 6.1 which it comes with Hadoop 3.0 and Spark 2.4! I am trying to compile it myself, but I have a question. I have cloned the repo and checkout to branch-0.8 which I can see it has this already merged into. I have built it as follow but still tells me Spark 2.4 is not supported:
```
./dev/change_scala_version.sh 2.11
 mvn package -DskipTests -Pspark-2.0 -Phadoop-2.4 -Pscala-2.11
```

Shall I use `-Pspark-2.4` or `-Pspark-2.0`? Or this is not related to my issue?
Thank you!

To answer my own basic question! Yes, it has to be -Pspark-2.4! But it didn't work on my macOS:

```
[WARNING] The requested profile "spark-2.4" could not be activated because it does not exist.
[WARNING] The requested profile "hadoop-3.0" could not be activated because it does not exist.
```

I did it again on my Ubuntu which is part of Cloudera cluster and it went perfectly. (obviously, Hadoop 3.0 still not available in the profiles, but it didn't change anything)
Now I have:

```
spark.version
res0: String = 2.4.0-cdh6.1.0
```

Can't wait for this release and 0.9.0! Great work and thank you.

How far would you like to rest API with oauth 2 to be described ?
I made it works with Postman and here is a link describing the steps to do it by script but there is an intermediate step which is manual https://developer.okta.com/blog/2018/07/16/oauth-2-command-line. I don't plan to do the authentication code flow like described but it will be specific to keycloak interface.

> 
> 
> How far would you like to rest API with oauth 2 to be described ?
> I made it works with Postman and here is a link describing the steps to do it by script but there is an intermediate step which is manual https://developer.okta.com/blog/2018/07/16/oauth-2-command-line. I don't plan to do the authentication code flow like described but it will be specific to keycloak interface.

A mention in the documentation that for rest endpoints to work when keycloak authentication is enabled procedure as described in the link can be used. If this is included in the documentation i think it will be sufficient. Thanks for the link.

I have some bad news related to Spark 2.4 and `commons-lang3` compatibility:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-3939

Unfortunately, it is not possible to test everything in a new Spark/Hadoop/CDH at once. I successfully ran an ML pipeline, read from parquet, but after a day I realized I can't read JSON and CSV files.
@conker84 ping - this was reverted, could you re-open
@felixcheung sorry I lost this, do you mean open a new issue? Because I cannot reopen this one

Is there a way to build a local Zeppelin without building all the interpreters?  I get an error when running maven on the `zeppelin-beam` interpreter project.

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project zeppelin-beam: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.zeppelin:zeppelin-beam:jar:0.9.0-SNAPSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: io.netty:netty-handler-proxy:jar:4.1.8.Final, com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-protos:jar:0.9.6.2, com.google.auth:google-auth-library-appengine:jar:0.6.0: Could not transfer artifact io.netty:netty-handler-proxy:jar:4.1.8.Final from/to nexus-central (https://nexus..../repository/maven-public): Failed to transfer file https://nexus..../repository/maven-public/io/netty/netty-handler-proxy/4.1.8.Final/netty-handler-proxy-4.1.8.Final.jar with status code 504 -> [Help 1]
```
hm, this is a bit tricky - could you open a new branch and cherry-pick the commits to it, then open a new PR? @conker84

I'm fixed problem with "infinite number of GET request".
Please review this pr somebody.

something wrong with maven central? I'm not sure. also travis has this odd error:

```
python ./travis_check.py sirianni f04416ed5e03eb245f2cd04e8af5d517956996ae
Traceback (most recent call last):

LGTM
merging if no more comment
@felixcheung What about merge?)

Sorry for responding late. Thanks @whai2kay for testing it out and confirming configure spark using "spark.master" interpreter conf.

This is just an initial implementation and it can be a starting point to improvements from applying Kubernetes client library to network policy for security, and so on.

I'd like to merge this PR to master, so we can start working on further improvements, If there's no more comments.

Hi @felixcheung. I've tried to set `CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:$HADOOP_CLASSPATH` before running `bin/zeppelin.sh`, but that causes Zeppelin to crash (I was getting errors like "class not found"). Setting `ZEPPELIN_CLASSPATH` worked just fine for me.

Just copy my comment in jira here.


> It is risky to put hadoop libraries on the CLASSPATH of zeppelin server. Because it may cause jar conflicts. For notebook storage, we use plugin for NotebookRepo in zeppelin 0.9, you can put extra dependencies in the plugin folder. Hadoop NotebookRepo is located in $ZEPPELIN_HOME/plugins/NotebookRepo/FileSystemNotebookRepo

@zjffdu Indeed, adding Hadoop JARs to `CLASSPATH` caused conflicts in my environment, but adding them to `ZEPPELIN_CLASSPATH` seems to work good (https://github.com/mcapuccini/spark-tensorflow/blob/master/Dockerfile). Ins't `$ZEPPELIN_HOME/plugins/NotebookRepo/FileSystemNotebookRepo` added to the `ZEPPELIN_CLASSPATH` ultimately?
@mcapuccini Plugin use separate ClassLoader which is different from that of ZeppelinServer.
@felixcheung could you merge changes or give some feedback??
@fred521 please consider contributing ;)
hey sorry about missing this. I'm going to check this PR now if you'd like to see my comment (here https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3205#discussion_r248539269).

> is there js test we could add?

I agree, just will take more time to write the test framework for this bug.
could you also update the images in the PR description to reflect the final visual (these gets linked to in the commit later) https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/3205#issue-223576707

I think you should try to use ZEPPELIN_CLASSPATH_OVERRIDES instead of ZEPPELIN_CLASSPATH(on your own risk) As @zjffdu said, additional jars in base classpath may cause jar conflicts and troubles in runtime.

Ok! I'll try and I'll let you know. It would be nice though to to have it set automatically by the startup script. Zeppelin is an Apache project, and I would expect HADOOP_CLASSPATH to be added automatically like it happens for Spark.
Thank you for review, description is updated.

LGTM
merging if no more comment

@HyukjinKwon @zjffdu @Leemoonsoo is it possible to shade Spark and Hadoop related dependencies when there is already Spark and Hadoop exist? I was thinking to avoid situations like this, to have a type of build where it shades all the deps for users with Spark and Hadoop. 
Do you think this could work?

you can rewrite log and force push - or it might be easier to open a new PR
